Package ohos.agp.render

Class Paint

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.render.Paint

  • public class Paint
extends Object
    Describes drawing style and color.

    This class provides style, color, and drawing mode for drawing geometric graphics, text, and pixelMaps. It provides parameters for the Canvas class. A Paint object must be destroyed after it has been used.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Paint.FontMetrics
      Describes fonts of the same size in multiple metrics.
      static class  Paint.Join
      Enumerates line join styles of a paint.
      static class  Paint.MaskType
      Indicates the required shape for a mask.
      static class  Paint.ShaderType
      Indicates the shader type, which specifies how the colors in the paint are shaded.
      static class  Paint.StrokeCap
      Indicates the paint stroke cap, which specifies the shape of each drawing point of a paint stroke.
      static class  Paint.Style
      Indicates the paint style type.

      • color

        public Color color
        Indicates the Color attribute of the current Paint object.

      • dashPathEffectIntervals

        public float[] dashPathEffectIntervals
        Indicates the dashPathEffectIntervals attribute of this Paint.

        Values in dashPathEffectIntervals are in pairs: The even and odd indices of these values specify the number of pixels to draw and the number of blank pixels respectively.

        Since:
        3

      • gradientShaderColor

        public Color[] gradientShaderColor
        Indicates the gradientShaderColor attribute of this Paint.

        gradientShaderColor specifies two gradient color values for the Paint.

        Since:
        3

        public void setFilterBitmap​(boolean filter)
        Sets the FilterBitmap attribute for a Paint.

        The FilterBitmap attribute is used to filter image bitmaps during transformation.

        Parameters:

      • setStrokeCap

        public void setStrokeCap​(Paint.StrokeCap cap)
        Sets the stroke cap for a Paint.

        The stroke cap represents the shape of each drawing point of a paint stroke, which is usually seen at the start and end points of an open drawing path. The value can be StrokeCap#BUTT_CAP, StrokeCap#ROUND_CAP, or StrokeCap#SQUARE_CAP.

        Parameters:
        cap - Indicates the stroke cap of the paint.
        Since:
        3

      • getStrokeCap

        Obtains the stroke cap of this Paint.
        Returns:
        Returns the stroke cap of the Paint.
        Since:
        3

        Parameters:

        Sets the Paint#dashPathEffectIntervals value array for a Paint.

        public void setDashPathEffectPhase​(float phase)
        Sets the offset for dash path effect intervals of a Paint.

        After setting the Paint#dashPathEffectIntervals value array, you can use this method to set the offset between each value pair in the array.

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha​(float alpha)
        Sets an alpha value.

        The alpha value ranges from 0.0f to 1.0f. The value 0.0f indicates completely transparent; the value 1.0f indicates completely opaque.

        Parameters:
        alpha - Indicates the alpha value, which is a float value.

      • getAlpha

        public float getAlpha​()

        The alpha value ranges from 0.0f to 1.0f. The value 0.0f indicates completely transparent; the value 1.0f indicates completely opaque.

        Returns:
        Returns the alpha value, which is a float value.

      • setShader

        public void setShader​(Shader newShader,
                      Paint.ShaderType type)
        Sets the Shader and ShaderType for this Paint.

        When drawing an object, the Paint obtains shading colors from the Shader. If newShader is null, the shader is cleared from the paint.

        Parameters:
        newShader - Indicates the shader to set for the paint.
        type - Indicates the type of the new shader.
        Since:
        3

      • getDisplayNumber

        public int getDisplayNumber​(String text,
                            boolean isMeasuredForwards,
                            float maxWidth,
                            float[] measuredWidth)
        Calculates the number of characters that can be displayed within the specified width.

        The text will be truncated if its width exceeds maxWidth. This method is usually used for text typesetting.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text to measure.
        isMeasuredForwards - Specifies how the text measurement should start. true indicates the measurement starts from left to right, and false indicates the opposite case.
        maxWidth - Indicates the specified maximum width.
        measuredWidth - Indicates the width of each character displayed within the specified width.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of characters that can be displayed within the specified width.
        Since:
        3

      • getAdvanceWidths

        public int getAdvanceWidths​(String text,
                            float[] widths)
        Obtains the text width in advance.

        The text width can be used for text typesetting.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text to measure.
        widths - Indicates the width of each character.
        Returns:
        Returns the text width.
        Since:
        3

      • ascent

        public float ascent​()
        Obtains the furthest distance of this text string above the baseline.
        Returns:
        Returns a negative value representing the furthest distance above the baseline.
        Since:
        3

      • descent

        public float descent​()
        Obtains the furthest distance of this text string below the baseline.
        Returns:
        Returns a positive value representing the furthest distance below the baseline.
        Since:
        3

      • horizontalZoom

        public void horizontalZoom​(float zoomH)
        Sets the horizontal zoom factor for this text.

        The default value of zoomH is 1. If the value is greater than 1, the text is stretched horizontally. Otherwise, the image is compressed horizontally.

        Parameters:
        zoomH - Indicates the horizontal zoom factor.
        Since:
        3

      • horizontalTilt

        public void horizontalTilt​(float tiltH)
        Sets the horizontal tilt factor for this text.

        The parameter tiltH is not limited to a specific range. The default value is 0. A positive value indicates that the text is tilted to the left, and a negative value indicates that the text is tilted to the right.

        Parameters:
        tiltH - Indicates the horizontal tilt factor.
        Since:
        3

      • setStrikeThrough

        public void setStrikeThrough​(boolean isStrikeThrough)
        Sets whether to add a strikethrough for this text.
        Parameters:
        isStrikeThrough - Specifies whether to add a strikethrough for this text. true indicates that a strikethrough is added, and false (default value) indicates the opposite case.
        Since:
        3

      • setUnderLine

        public void setUnderLine​(boolean isUnderLine)
        Sets whether to add an underline for this text.
        Parameters:
        isUnderLine - Specifies whether to add an underline for this text. true indicates that an underline is added, and false (default value) indicates the opposite case.
        Since:
        3

      • setSubpixelAntiAlias

        public void setSubpixelAntiAlias​(boolean isSubpixel)
        Sets whether to enable sub-pixel anti-aliasing for improving text legibility on an LCD screen.
        Parameters:
        isSubpixel - Specifies whether to enable sub-pixel anti-aliasing. true indicates that sub-pixel anti-aliasing is enabled, and false indicates the opposite case.
        Since:
        3

      • addTextToPath

        public void addTextToPath​(String text,
                          float xCoor,
                          float yCoor,
                          Path path)
        Adds a text to Path.
        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text to add.
        xCoor - Indicates the x-coordinate of the text to add.
        yCoor - Indicates the y-coordinate of the text to add.
        path - Indicates the path for the text. After the text is added, it can be drawn along the path by calling Canvas#drawPath.
        Since:
        3

      • setStrokeMiter

        public void setStrokeMiter​(float miter)
        Sets the stroke miter for this Paint.
        Parameters:
        miter - Indicates the stroke miter to set.
        Since:
        3

      • getFillPath

        public boolean getFillPath​(Path src,
                           Path dst)
        Obtains the actual contour of the source path and saves the obtained path to dst.

        The drawing effect of the destination path after it is filled with the default paint should be the same as that of the source path.

        Parameters:
        src - Indicates the source path.
        dst - Indicates the destination path.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getRecommendedLineSpacing

        public float getRecommendedLineSpacing​()
        Obtains the recommended line spacing.
        Returns:
        Returns the recommended line spacing, in pixels.
        Since:
        4

      • setLetterSpacing

        public void setLetterSpacing​(float spacing)
        Sets the letter spacing for this Paint.
        Parameters:
        spacing - Indicates the letter spacing to set, in pixels.
        Since:
        4

      • isUnderLined

        public final boolean isUnderLined​()
        Checks whether the font in this Paint is underlined.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the font is underlined; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
